author: tpena
title: Infrastructure & Blockchain
description:
Corrupção que impede o desenvolvimento. Usando a cadeia de bloqueios como um processo à prova de tolos no desenvolvimento.
O objetivo é descentralizar usando a cadeia de bloqueios.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of corruption in government funded projects by creating a decentralized government project management solution that includes a land registry which aligns with the challenge goal of a foundational property registration dApp.
The proposal does a good job of articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges.
The proposal could be improved by articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem and providing key metrics and goals that more closely align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of technical explanation of the solution (needs more details).
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by evidence of experience (linkedin profile or website), team composition, a reasonable budget breakdown, realistic timetable and plan, resources required, and a challenges and risks section. The proposal selects a community where "there is limited information about this community" which seems to be a poor choice based upon info given. A better choice would be a community that the proposer has information about, ties with and which has a local authority willing to work with the proposer.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem although these two could be much better aligned. Consider a proposal for just the land registry phase (with future phases funded in subsequent rounds) and making the problem description about the need for land registry information; to better align solution, problem and challenge.
To improve the proposal include a roadmap, milestones, time horizon and metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success.

f6_assessments.q0: A very interesting proposal that fits the challenge. The problem and solution are well explained and it is great that you plan to start with a pilot project, however, the timing and plan to scale are not clear, so the impact on the challenge KPIs is not clear and therefore I rated only 4.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a lot of missing information to define the feasibility including details about the team as well as clear roadmaps, timing, and detailed budget. It seems a complex project and without detailed info, the feasibility is low. There are also not clear deliverables and KPIs as well missing challenges and risks (which there are many here). Great that you focus on a pilot location.
f6_assessments.q2: Missing clear deliverables and KPIs to show how to audit the proposal. What success will look like? Please look at this guide to see how the CA evaluate the proposals. It will help to improve the proposal for the next fund. https://cardanocataly.st/en/community-advisor/guide.html

f6_assessments.q0:
Undoubtedly the proposal has a vision that can really have a positive impact on the lives of communities whose developing nations are overflowing with corruption and bureaucracy.  It is in the final lines of the proposal that it becomes clear what the proponent's purpose is: to conduct a study of the possibilities of Blockchain technology in the management of infrastructure projects.  

It is clear to all of us involved in the quest for a decentralized world that puts an end to many of the centralized practices that bring out the worst in human society that much of the blockchain infrastructure to be implemented in the many areas of human life is in the process of being built.  It is no secret that the current era, the present in which we live, is a period of exploration of the potential of decentralized technology.   

It is precisely in this exploratory scenario that the type of studies proposed in this proposal are necessary.  For the good of our ecosystem, of other ecosystems and of human society in general, such studies should be encouraged.
f6_assessments.q1:
Three terms are used indiscriminately in the proposal (including the Word document attached to the proposal): protocol, study, approach.    The creation of a protocol is mentioned at the beginning of the proposal (section "Describe your solution to the problem").  A study is mentioned at the end of the proposal ("Study Interest: Determine the effects of decentralization on infrastructure ...").  The word document attached to the proposal talks about developing an approach ("The approach to creating a planned developed approach to infrastructure development using...").  While the general description of the problem environment and the role that blockchain technology would play in implementing a possible solution is clear and compelling, the scarce of detail and lack of depth of information in the description of the technical process of implementing the proposal, makes the specific purpose of the proposal unclear and forces the reader to make many assumptions.   Lack of information about of the proposing team, budget, roadmap, possible risks that could hinder or prevent the implementation of the proposal, among other aspects, accentuate the difficulty that interferes in creating a clear picture of the proposal and its scope.

Question: what is the specific role of Motré Co. LLC in the implementation of the proposal?
f6_assessments.q2: There are no KPIs to measure the proposal's performance.
